definition: Feng Youlan (1895-1990), distinguished Chinese philosopher
surname Feng
to gallop/to assist/to attack/to wade/great/old variant of 憑|凭[ping2]
friend
surname Lan/abbr. for Lanzhou 蘭州|兰州[Lan2 zhou1], Gansu
orchid (蘭花|兰花 Cymbidium goeringii)/fragrant thoroughwort (蘭草|兰草 Eupatorium fortunei)/lily magnolia (木蘭|木兰)

sentences.english: Feng Youlan has summarized this realm as grace.
sentences.chinese: 冯友兰将这种境界概括为风流。

sentences.english: In a sense, it is an embodiment of his philosophical ideas.
sentences.chinese: 从一定意义上讲，它浓缩了冯友兰的全部哲学思想。

definition: Liang Shuming (1893-1988), modern philosopher and teacher in the neo-Confucian tradition
Hu Shi (1891-1962), original proponent of writing in colloquial Chinese 白話文|白话文[bai2 hua4 wen2]
Ji Xianlin (1911-2009), Chinese linguist and Indologist
Liu Shipei (1884-1919), Chinese anarchist and revolutionary activist
Cai Yuanpei (1868-1940), liberal educationalist, studied in Germany, president of Peking University 1917-19, minister of education for Guomindang
Wang Guowei (1877-1927), noted scholar
Liang Qichao (1873-1929), influential journalist and a leader of the failed reform movement of 1898
Zhang Taiyan (1869-1936), scholar, journalist, revolutionary and leading intellectual around the time of the Xinhai revolution

Zhou Zuoren (1885-1967), brother of Lu Xun 魯迅|鲁迅, academic in Japanese and Greek studies, briefly imprisoned after the war as Japanese collaborator, persecuted and died of unknown causes during the Cultural Revolution
Wen Yiduo (1899-1946), poet and patriotic fighter, executed by Guomindang in Kunming
Lu Xun (1881-1936), one of the earliest and best-known modern Chinese writers
Contemporary New Confucianism/see 新儒家[Xin1 Ru2 jia1]
Yuen Ren Chao (1892-1982), Chinese-American linguist
Fei Xiaotong (1910-2005), Chinese sociologist
Jian Bozan (1898-1968), Chinese Marxist historian and vice-president of Bejing University 1952-1968
Yan Fu (1853-1921), influential Chinese writer and translator of Western books, esp. on social sciences
